alert.note: Alert for Northeast Foothills, Sacramento Valley; Western Plumas County, Lassen Park (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 24 at 3:56PM PST until February 25 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM PST SATURDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH LATE TUESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations of 2 to 5 inches. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 18 inches possible above 1500 feet and 2 to 6 feet above 2500 feet. Winds could gust as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Northeast Foothills/Sacramento Valley and Western Plumas County/Lassen Park Counties. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until 4 AM PST Saturday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from late Saturday night through late Tuesday night. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible with extended road closures. Blowing snow will cause white-out conditions at times. Downed trees and tree limbs and local power outages are possible due to heavy snow and gusty winds. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow levels 2500 to 3500 feet Sunday falling to 1500 to 2500 feet Monday. Periods of heavy snow Sunday with snow showers lingering into Sunday night. Another round of heavy snow is expected Monday into early Wednesday.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Northeast Foothills, Sacramento Valley; Western Plumas County, Lassen Park
